issue.title: Decoding base64 body
issue.body:
Hi, Zaahid! Hope for your advice.

We receive non-standard emails from the same sender.
[mail_example.txt](https://github.com/zbateson/mail-mime-parser/files/9937256/mail_example.txt) as example (Some data has been removed, but this does not affect the main problem).
Email with headers:
```
Content-Type: multipart/mixed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
```
The sender uses SAP Web Application Server 7.00, which encodes the entire body of the message in base64 encoding.
According to RFC [1521](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1521#section-5) such email is not valid
`If a Content-Transfer-Encoding header field appears as part of a message header, it applies to the entire body of that message. If a Content-Transfer-Encoding header field appears as part of a body part's headers, it applies only to the body of that body part. If an entity is of type "multipart" or "message", the Content-Transfer-Encoding is not permitted to have any value other than a bit width (e.g., "7bit", "8bit", etc.) or "binary`

As a workaround, we now use this construction
```
before check multipart/mixed and base64 and entire body is encoded in base64
$message = $zBatesonMimeParser->parse($nonStandardMail, false);
$message->removeHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding");
$message->addRawHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");
$message->setContent(base64_decode($message->getContent()));
$message2 = $zBatesonMimeParser->parse($message->getStream(), false);
```
Perhaps there are better ways to do this?

Thank you for your attention.

issue.title: Can't get inline image from Gmail API
issue.body:
Hello,

`<?php
// ...
$mime = ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Message::from(Base64Url::decode($mail->getRaw()));
echo $mime->getHtmlContent();`

I'm getting the right mail, with HTML like i want, but images sources are replaced by : `cid:image.png`.
I understand that they put images in attachments, but can't get a way to make it work.

comment.body:
Hi @didi1357 --

Thanks for that -- I'm sure people will find it helpful searching like you have :)

Beyond scope meaning I don't think it belong in the library.  It's certainly adjacent and very close, but not related to the actual parsing and reading of email content.  I could see it be desirable to an 'email client' that uses an email parser to read emails _and also displays_ the email to an end user, but there could be many 'very close' things (like maybe finding the 'reply' portion of an email, stripping out the rest) that aren't strictly 'parsing' and should be in separate libraries.

All the best and thanks again!

issue.title: A very belated bug report
issue.body:
Hi Zaahid,

I hope you're well, where ever you are at the moment. 

I have a very belated bug report for version 2+ of the library. A week ago I updated my last module to version 2.2.3 (the most recent version) and we got mysterious issues with AWS refusing to process our emails due too the email size being larger than 40Mb (their upper limit). When looking at the emails they were all well below < 40 Mb. So a conundrum! After adding logging at several places it became apparent that the mailmimeparser was increasing the size of the emails by a factor of 3. I've been able to pinpoint this behaviour to the function setAsMultipartSigned. I've included a small movie with the logging output. You can see that the email is 20MB when read into mailmimeparser and as soon as I call setAsMultipartSigned it balloons the email size to 63 MB. Don't know why, don't know how :-)

[screen-capture (15).webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/461034/197528787-b37b9c52-9c64-4a6f-9edb-4968727907b8.webm)

Kind regards
Meint

comment.body:
Hi Meint,

Nice to hear from you :)

Interesting issue you're encountering... I had a quick look with a 4.7MB test file (from the MMP test suite: m3005.txt), and calling 'setAsMultipartSigned' and 'save()' on the message, I'm getting a 4.7MB output file with signed parts.

I then used my largest example attachment, attaching it 3 more times to m3005.txt and creating a new email that's 18.7MB, and did the same thing -- the output is also 18.7MB.

Is that your path too?  Basically calling setAsMultipartSigned and then save() on it?  Are you also adding the signature at this point maybe with setSignature?

Lastly, is the original message a mime message with an attachment that's base64 encoded?  Anything else interesting about the message?

This is my full test code:

```php
$message = Message::from(Psr7\Utils::streamFor(fopen('m3005.txt', 'r')), true);
$message->setAsMultipartSigned('tst', 'tst');
$message->save('output-message.txt');
```

Feel free to email me as well if there's something to add privately that you don't want added here.

All the best :)
Zaahid

issue.title: Fix PHP 8.1 return type deprecation notices.
issue.body:
Fix deprecation notices like:
`Method "Psr\Http\Message\StreamInterface::close()" might add "void" as a native return type declaration in the future. Do the same in implementation "ZBateson\StreamDecorators\NonClosingStream" now to avoid errors or add an explicit @return annotation to suppress this message.`

comment.body: Wonderful thanks again, will release right away

issue.title: Memory Leak
issue.body:
I have a long-running script and I noticed that memory usage rises slowly over time until it exceeds the maximum memory limit set for PHP.

I'm wondering if something isn't being removed when I unset the message.

You can see it happening live by running this test script:
```
<?php

$email = '
From: "Doug Sauder" <doug@example.com>
To: "J�rgen Schm�rgen" <schmuergen@example.com>
Subject: Die Hasen und
   die Fr�sche (Microsoft Outlook 00)
Date: Wed, 17 May 2000 19:08:29 -0400
Message-ID: <NDBBIAKOPKHFGPLCODIGIEKBCHAA.doug@example.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
  charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook IMO, Build 9.0.2416 (9.0.2910.0)
Importance: Normal
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V5.00.2314.1300

Die Hasen und die Fr�sche

Die Hasen klagten einst �ber ihre mi�liche Lage; "wir leben", sprach ein
Redner, "in steter Furcht vor Menschen und Tieren, eine Beute der Hunde, der
Adler, ja fast aller Raubtiere! Unsere stete Angst ist �rger als der Tod
selbst. Auf, la�t uns ein f�r allemal sterben."

In einem nahen Teich wollten sie sich nun ers�ufen; sie eilten ihm zu;
allein das au�erordentliche Get�se und ihre wunderbare Gestalt erschreckte
eine Menge Fr�sche, die am Ufer sa�en, so sehr, da� sie aufs schnellste
untertauchten.

"Halt", rief nun eben dieser Sprecher, "wir wollen das Ers�ufen noch ein
wenig aufschieben, denn auch uns f�rchten, wie ihr seht, einige Tiere,
welche also wohl noch ungl�cklicher sein m�ssen als wir."
';

echo "Memory usage before: " . memory_get_usage(true) . PHP_EOL;

$i = 0;
while($i < 5000) {
    $message = \ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Message::from($email, false);
    unset($message);

    $i++;
}

echo "Memory usage after: " . memory_get_usage(true) . PHP_EOL;
```

Output from script:
```
user@testing:~/cliapps$ php app.php 
Memory usage before: 6291456
Memory usage after: 20971520
```

pull_request.title: Handle iconv crash if encoding not supported
pull_request.body: `MbWrapper.php` **Handle iconv crash if encoding not supported** ``` [E_WARNING] Unsupported charset "X-IAS-German": mb_convert_encoding(): Illegal character encoding specified imap_alerts (0): imap_errors (0): ```

repo.name: MailMimeParser
repo.description: A PHP mail mime parser

repo.name: mail-mime-parser
repo.description: An email parser written in PHP

issue.title: Handle iconv crash if encoding not supported
issue.body: `MbWrapper.php` **Handle iconv crash if encoding not supported** ``` [E_WARNING] Unsupported charset "X-IAS-German": mb_convert_encoding(): Illegal character encoding specified imap_alerts (0): imap_errors (0): ```

comment.body:
Hi @shotap --

Appreciate the effort, but there are quite a few issues with this:

a) All the iconv/mb code's been moved to mbwrapper, so I think what you think you're committing isn't included (see 'changed files' tab), instead it's: changing the name of my repo, changing how I store header names, reverting some date header parsing code, and modifying PartBuilder... none of which apply to the stated goal of this pull request

b) Looking at some of the commits, you added additional code for things like 'charset name case insensitivity'.  I can't say what it was back when you cloned this repo, but currently in mb-wrapper that's already handled here: https://github.com/zbateson/mb-wrapper/blob/master/src/MbWrapper.php#L316

c) It seems you've added additional code to handle common misspellings of charsets, like iso-8859-i instead of 1.  I generally reject those unless it's coming from a prominent mailer/system.  Anyone can make a mistake and write a faulty piece of code, but 99% of cases that should be fixed on the other end, rather than chasing every possible incorrect implementation.

Again, thanks for the effort though.  I encourage you to create some issues in the mb-wrapper project if there's still something not working/crashing for you, and I'll be happy to guide you towards fixing it/finding a solution :)

All the best

commits.message: Fix issue with 'not' row exclusions
Add TestRequirements

pull_request.title: Make hash.txt optional with a warning message
pull_request.body:
@armenak --

The static loading for hash.txt in Core.java spits out an ugly error message even if not using encryption methods.  I propose we change it so:

1. A small warning message appears instead without a stack trace
2. An error is shown when calling 'getHash' if getHash is null, and an exception is thrown at that point

If that looks okay to you, feel free to merge :)

Thanks,
Zaahid

issue.title: Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment
issue.body:
Currently the comment and signature of `IMessage::setHtmlPart` is

```php
    /**
     * [...]
     * @param string $contentTypeCharset the charset to use as the text/html
     *        part's content-type header charset value.
     */
    public function setHtmlPart($resource, $charset = 'UTF-8');
```

Symfony's DeprecationErrorHandler thinks that in the next main version of the package there will be a new parameter for this function:

> Remaining indirect deprecation notices (1)
> 
>  1x: The "ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Message::setHtmlPart()" method will require a new "string $contentTypeCharset" argument in the next major version of its interface "ZBateson\MailMimeParser\IMessage", not defining it is deprecated.

So I propose to change the parameter's name in the interface according to the name in the php doc.

comment.body: Thanks @naitsirch

commits.message: Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment

Merge pull request #189 from naitsirch/fix_phpdoc_of_message

Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment

pull_request.title: Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment
pull_request.body:
Currently the comment and signature of `IMessage::setHtmlPart` is

```php
    /**
     * [...]
     * @param string $contentTypeCharset the charset to use as the text/html
     *        part's content-type header charset value.
     */
    public function setHtmlPart($resource, $charset = 'UTF-8');
```

Symfony's DeprecationErrorHandler thinks that in the next main version of the package there will be a new parameter for this function:

> Remaining indirect deprecation notices (1)
> 
>  1x: The "ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Message::setHtmlPart()" method will require a new "string $contentTypeCharset" argument in the next major version of its interface "ZBateson\MailMimeParser\IMessage", not defining it is deprecated.

So I propose to change the parameter's name in the interface according to the name in the php doc.

issue.title: Decoding base64 body
issue.body:
Hi, Zaahid! Hope for your advice.

We receive non-standard emails from the same sender.
[mail_example.txt](https://github.com/zbateson/mail-mime-parser/files/9937256/mail_example.txt) as example (Some data has been removed, but this does not affect the main problem).
Email with headers:
```
Content-Type: multipart/mixed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
```
The sender uses SAP Web Application Server 7.00, which encodes the entire body of the message in base64 encoding.
According to RFC [1521](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1521#section-5) such email is not valid

If a Content-Transfer-Encoding header field appears as part of a body part's headers, it applies only to the body of that body part. If an entity is of type "multipart" or "message", the Content-Transfer-Encoding is not permitted to have any value other than a bit width (e.g., "7bit", "8bit", etc.) or "binary`

As a workaround, we now use this construction
```
before check multipart/mixed and base64 and entire body is encoded in base64
$message = $zBatesonMimeParser->parse($nonStandardMail, false);
$message->removeHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding");
$message->addRawHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");
$message->setContent(base64_decode($message->getContent()));
$message2 = $zBatesonMimeParser->parse($message->getStream(), false);
```
Perhaps there are better ways to do this?

Thank you for your attention.

issue.title: Fix PHP 8.1 return type deprecation notices.
issue.body:
Fix deprecation notices like:
`Method "Psr\Http\Message\StreamInterface::close()" might add "void" as a native return type declaration in the future. Do the same in implementation "ZBateson\StreamDecorators\NonClosingStream" now to avoid errors or add an explicit @return annotation to suppress this message.`

comment.body: Wonderful thanks again, will release right away

issue.title: Memory Leak
issue.body:
I have a long-running script and I noticed that memory usage rises slowly over time until it exceeds the maximum memory limit set for PHP.

I'm wondering if something isn't being removed when I unset the message.

You can see it happening live by running this test script:
```
<?php

$email = '
From: "Doug Sauder" <doug@example.com>
To: "J�rgen Schm�rgen" <schmuergen@example.com>
Subject: Die Hasen und
   die Fr�sche (Microsoft Outlook 00)
Date: Wed, 17 May 2000 19:08:29 -0400
Message-ID: <NDBBIAKOPKHFGPLCODIGIEKBCHAA.doug@example.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain;
  charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
X-MSMail-Priority: Normal
X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook IMO, Build 9.0.2416 (9.0.2910.0)
Importance: Normal
X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V5.00.2314.1300

Die Hasen und die Fr�sche

Die Hasen klagten einst �ber ihre mi�liche Lage; "wir leben", sprach ein
Redner, "in steter Furcht vor Menschen und Tieren, eine Beute der Hunde, der
Adler, ja fast aller Raubtiere! Unsere stete Angst ist �rger als der Tod
selbst. Auf, la�t uns ein f�r allemal sterben."

In einem nahen Teich wollten sie sich nun ers�ufen; sie eilten ihm zu;
allein das au�erordentliche Get�se und ihre wunderbare Gestalt erschreckte
eine Menge Fr�sche, die am Ufer sa�en, so sehr, da� sie aufs schnellste
untertauchten.

"Halt", rief nun eben dieser Sprecher, "wir wollen das Ers�ufen noch ein
wenig aufschieben, denn auch uns f�rchten, wie ihr seht, einige Tiere,
welche also wohl noch ungl�cklicher sein m�ssen als wir."
';

echo "Memory usage before: " . memory_get_usage(true) . PHP_EOL;

$i = 0;
while($i < 5000) {
    $message = \ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Message::from($email, false);
    unset($message);

    $i++;
}

echo "Memory usage after: " . memory_get_usage(true) . PHP_EOL;
```

Output from script:
```
user@testing:~/cliapps$ php app.php 
Memory usage before: 6291456
Memory usage after: 20971520
```

pull_request.title: Handle iconv crash if encoding not supported
pull_request.body: `MbWrapper.php` **Handle iconv crash if encoding not supported** ``` [E_WARNING] Unsupported charset "X-IAS-German": mb_convert_encoding(): Illegal character encoding specified imap_alerts (0): imap_errors (0): ```

repo.name: MailMimeParser
repo.description: A PHP mail mime parser

repo.name: mail-mime-parser
repo.description: An email parser written in PHP

issue.title: Handle iconv crash if encoding not supported
issue.body: `MbWrapper.php` **Handle iconv crash if encoding not supported** ``` [E_WARNING] Unsupported charset "X-IAS-German": mb_convert_encoding(): Illegal character encoding specified imap_alerts (0): imap_errors (0): ```

comment.body:
Hi @shotap --

Appreciate the effort, but there are quite a few issues with this:

a) All the iconv/mb code's been moved to mbwrapper, so I think what you think you're committing isn't included (see 'changed files' tab), instead it's: changing the name of my repo, changing how I store header names, reverting some date header parsing code, and modifying PartBuilder... none of which apply to the stated goal of this pull request

b) Looking at some of the commits, you added additional code for things like 'charset name case insensitivity'.  I can't say what it was back when you cloned this repo, but currently in mb-wrapper that's already handled here: https://github.com/zbateson/mb-wrapper/blob/master/src/MbWrapper.php#L316

c) It seems you've added additional code to handle common misspellings of charsets, like iso-8859-i instead of 1.  I generally reject those unless it's coming from a prominent mailer/system.  Anyone can make a mistake and write a faulty piece of code, but 99% of cases that should be fixed on the other end, rather than chasing every possible incorrect implementation.

Again, thanks for the effort though.  I encourage you to create some issues in the mb-wrapper project if there's still something not working/crashing for you, and I'll be happy to guide you towards fixing it/finding a solution :)

All the best

commits.message: Fix issue with 'not' row exclusions
Add TestRequirements

pull_request.title: Make hash.txt optional with a warning message
pull_request.body:
@armenak --

The static loading for hash.txt in Core.java spits out an ugly error message even if not using encryption methods.  I propose we change it so:

1. A small warning message appears instead without a stack trace
2. An error is shown when calling 'getHash' if getHash is null, and an exception is thrown at that point

If that looks okay to you, feel free to merge :)

Thanks,
Zaahid

issue.title: Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment
issue.body:
Currently the comment and signature of `IMessage::setHtmlPart` is

```php
    /**
     * [...]
     * @param string $contentTypeCharset the charset to use as the text/html
     *        part's content-type header charset value.
     */
    public function setHtmlPart($resource, $charset = 'UTF-8');
```

Symfony's DeprecationErrorHandler thinks that in the next main version of the package there will be a new parameter for this function:

> Remaining indirect deprecation notices (1)
> 
>  1x: The "ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Message::setHtmlPart()" method will require a new "string $contentTypeCharset" argument in the next major version of its interface "ZBateson\MailMimeParser\IMessage", not defining it is deprecated.

So I propose to change the parameter's name in the interface according to the name in the php doc.

comment.body: Thanks @naitsirch

commits.message: Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment

Merge pull request #189 from naitsirch/fix_phpdoc_of_message

Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment

pull_request.title: Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment
pull_request.body:
Currently the comment and signature of `IMessage::setHtmlPart` is

```php
    /**
     * [...]
     * @param string $contentTypeCharset the charset to use as the text/html
     *        part's content-type header charset value.
     */
    public function setHtmlPart($resource, $charset = 'UTF-8');
```

Symfony's DeprecationErrorHandler thinks that in the next main version of the package there will be a new parameter for this function:

> Remaining indirect deprecation notices (1)
> 
>  1x: The "ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Message::setHtmlPart()" method will require a new "string $contentTypeCharset" argument in the next major version of its interface "ZBateson\MailMimeParser\IMessage", not defining it is deprecated.

So I propose to change the parameter's name in the interface according to the name in the php doc.

issue.title: Decoding base64 body
issue.body:
Hi, Zaahid! Hope for your advice.

We receive non-standard emails from the same sender.
[mail_example.txt](https://github.com/zbateson/mail-mime-parser/files/9937256/mail_example.txt) as example (Some data has been removed, but this does not affect the main problem).
Email with headers:
```
Content-Type: multipart/mixed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
```
The sender uses SAP Web Application Server 7.00, which encodes the entire body of the message in base64 encoding.
According to RFC [1521](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc1521#section-5) such email is not valid
`If a Content-Transfer-Encoding header field appears as part of a message header, it applies to the entire body of that message. If a Content-Transfer-Encoding header field appears as part of a body part's headers, it applies only to the body of that body part. If an entity is of type "multipart" or "message", the Content-Transfer-Encoding is not permitted to have any value other than a bit width (e.g., "7bit", "8bit", etc.) or "binary`

As a workaround, we now use this construction
```
before check multipart/mixed and base64 and entire body is encoded in base64
$message = $zBatesonMimeParser->parse($nonStandardMail, false);
$message->removeHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding");
$message->addRawHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "binary");
$message->setContent(base64_decode($message->getContent()));
$message2 = $zBatesonMimeParser->parse($message->getStream(), false);
```
Perhaps there are better ways to do this?

Thank you for your attention.

issue.title: Can't get inline image from Gmail API
issue.body:
Hello,

`<?php
// ...
$mime = ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Message::from(Base64Url::decode($mail->getRaw()));
echo $mime->getHtmlContent();`

I'm getting the right mail, with HTML like i want, but images sources are replaced by : `cid:image.png`.
I understand that they put images in attachments, but can't get a way to make it work.

comment.body:
Hi @didi1357 --

Thanks for that -- I'm sure people will find it helpful searching like you have :)

Beyond scope meaning I don't think it belong in the library.  It's certainly adjacent and very close, but not related to the actual parsing and reading of email content.  I could see it be desirable to an 'email client' that uses an email parser to read emails _and also displays_ the email to an end user, but there could be many 'very close' things (like maybe finding the 'reply' portion of an email, stripping out the rest) that aren't strictly 'parsing' and should be in separate libraries.

All the best and thanks again!

issue.title: A very belated bug report
issue.body:
Hi Zaahid,

I hope you're well, where ever you are at the moment. 

I have a very belated bug report for version 2+ of the library. A week ago I updated my last module to version 2.2.3 (the most recent version) and we got mysterious issues with AWS refusing to process our emails due too the email size being larger than 40Mb (their upper limit). When looking at the emails they were all well below < 40 Mb. So a conundrum! After adding logging at several places it became apparent that the mailmimeparser was increasing the size of the emails by a factor of 3. I've been able to pinpoint this behaviour to the function setAsMultipartSigned. I've included a small movie with the logging output. You can see that the email is 20MB when read into mailmimeparser and as soon as I call setAsMultipartSigned it balloons the email size to 63 MB. Don't know why, don't know how :-)

[screen-capture (15).webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/461034/197528787-b37b9c52-9c64-4a6f-9edb-4968727907b8.webm)

Kind regards
Meint

comment.body:
Hi Meint,

Nice to hear from you :)

Interesting issue you're encountering... I had a quick look with a 4.7MB test file (from the MMP test suite: m3005.txt), and calling 'setAsMultipartSigned' and 'save()' on the message, I'm getting a 4.7MB output file with signed parts.

I then used my largest example attachment, attaching it 3 more times to m3005.txt and creating a new email that's 18.7MB, and did the same thing -- the output is also 18.7MB.

Is that your path too?  Basically calling setAsMultipartSigned and then save() on it?  Are you also adding the signature at this point maybe with setSignature?

Lastly, is the original message a mime message with an attachment that's base64 encoded?  Anything else interesting about the message?

This is my full test code:

```php
$message = Message::from(Psr7\Utils::streamFor(fopen('m3005.txt', 'r')), true);
$message->setAsMultipartSigned('tst', 'tst');
$message->save('output-message.txt');
```

Feel free to email me as well if there's something to add privately that you don't want added here.

All the best :)
Zaahid

issue.title: Handle iconv crash if encoding not supported
issue.body: `MbWrapper.php` **Handle iconv crash if encoding not supported** ``` [E_WARNING] Unsupported charset "X-IAS-German": mb_convert_encoding(): Illegal character encoding specified imap_alerts (0): imap_errors (0): ```

comment.body:
Hi @shotap --

Appreciate the effort, but there are quite a few issues with this:

a) All the iconv/mb code's been moved to mbwrapper, so I think what you think you're committing isn't included (see 'changed files' tab), instead it's: changing the name of my repo, changing how I store header names, reverting some date header parsing code, and modifying PartBuilder... none of which apply to the stated goal of this pull request

b) Looking at some of the commits, you added additional code for things like 'charset name case insensitivity'.  I can't say what it was back when you cloned this repo, but currently in mb-wrapper that's already handled here: https://github.com/zbateson/mb-wrapper/blob/master/src/MbWrapper.php#L316

c) It seems you've added additional code to handle common misspellings of charsets, like iso-8859-i instead of 1.  I generally reject those unless it's coming from a prominent mailer/system.  Anyone can make a mistake and write a faulty piece of code, but 99% of cases that should be fixed on the other end, rather than chasing every possible incorrect implementation.

Again, thanks for the effort though.  I encourage you to create some issues in the mb-wrapper project if there's still something not working/crashing for you, and I'll be happy to guide you towards fixing it/finding a solution :)

All the best

Add TestRequirements

pull_request.title: Make hash.txt optional with a warning message
pull_request.body:
@armenak --

The static loading for hash.txt in Core.java spits out an ugly error message even if not using encryption methods.  I propose we change it so:

1. A small warning message appears instead without a stack trace
2. An error is shown when calling 'getHash' if getHash is null, and an exception is thrown at that point

If that looks okay to you, feel free to merge :)

Thanks,
Zaahid

issue.title: Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment
issue.body:
Currently the comment and signature of `IMessage::setHtmlPart` is

```php
    /**
     * [...]
     * @param string $contentTypeCharset the charset to use as the text/html
     *        part's content-type header charset value.
     */
    public function setHtmlPart($resource, $charset = 'UTF-8');
```

Symfony's DeprecationErrorHandler thinks that in the next main version of the package there will be a new parameter for this function:

> Remaining indirect deprecation notices (1)
> 
>  1x: The "ZBateson\MailMimeParser\Message::setHtmlPart()" method will require a new "string $contentTypeCharset" argument in the next major version of its interface "ZBateson\MailMimeParser\IMessage", not defining it is deprecated.

So I propose to change the parameter's name in the interface according to the name in the php doc.

comment.body: Thanks @naitsirch

commits.message: Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment

Merge pull request #189 from naitsirch/fix_phpdoc_of_message

Fix parameter name of IMessage::setHtmlPart according to docComment

```

Symfony's DeprecationErrorHandler thinks that in the next main version of the package there will be a new parameter for this function:

So I propose to change the parameter's name in the interface according to the name in the php doc.
